newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia net exports detract from Q4 GDP.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia net exports detract from Q4 GDP.

text.p: Australia's net exports in the December quarter made a negative contribution of 1.0 percentage points to expenditure-based gross domestic product (GDP), the Australian Bureau of Statistics said on Tuesday.

The bureau said the seasonally adjusted balance of trade in goods and services for the quarter showed a surplus of A$30 million in 1989/90 prices, from a surplus of A$1.155 billion (revised from a surplus of A$738 million) in the previous quarter. In volume terms, exports of goods and services rose one percent to A$25.920 billion, while imports rose five percent to A$25.890 billion.
Seasonally adjusted quarterly balance of payments data
Dec qtr 96 Sept qtr 96 Dec qtr 95
Seasonally adjusted quarterly balance of payments data:
Dec qtr 96 Sept qtr 96 Dec qtr 95

The bureau said the unadjusted December quarter capital account surplus of A$5.212 billion in current prices was made up of A$3.749 billion of net debt financing and A$2.105 billion of net equity financing.
Net other financing was a net outflow of A$642 million.
